speaker: ANNOUNCER
line: This is really shining right out into the studio. The malfunction cut off power to rural parts of Kroner County. Up next, the amazing story of two giant pandas in love. But first, let's check in with Holman Hardt and the weather.

speaker: HOLMAN
line: Well, still no rain in sight for the Kroner Hills region as yet another winter storm passes south of us. I'll have all the numbers and my five-day forecast right after this.

speaker: SHEILA
line: Hey, baby, you're home early.

speaker: DARYL
line: Sheila, we got a really big problem here. What in the hell were you thinking?

speaker: SHEILA
line: Happy Valentine's Day.

speaker: DARYL
line: We made a deal. We agreed to keep the engagement secret until I said so.

speaker: SHEILA
line: I know, but I just wanted everybody in town to know why I've been so happy the last few months.

speaker: HOLMAN
line: ...to yet another bone-dry day. Current temperature in Kroner is 45 degrees.

speaker: SHEILA
line: I know business has been slow but we can't stop living just 'cause it hasn't rained in a spell.

speaker: DARYL
line: Maybe we should just call off the engagement.

speaker: SHEILA
line: Don't do this, not today. It'll rain soon. I can feel it.

speaker: DARYL
line: I-I just need time to think. Oh, look at that. And you wonder why your ass is so big.

speaker: DARYL
line: : "It'll rain soon. I can feel it."

speaker: RADIO
line: What I got they used to call the blues Nothin' is really wrong Feelin' like I don't belong Walkin' around …

speaker: DARYL AND RADIO
line: Some kind of lonely clown Rainy Days and Mondays always get me down...

speaker: RADIO
line: Funny, but it seems I always wind up here with you Nice to know somebody loves me Funny, but it seems that it's the only thing to do Run and find the one who loves me

speaker: DARYL
line: I'll be damned.

speaker: RADIO
line: What I feel has come and gone before

speaker: DARYL
line: Yee-ha! Ow!

speaker: RADIO
line: No need to talk it out We know what it's all about Hangin' around Nothin' to do but frown Rainy days and Mondays always get me down Hangin' around Nothin' to do but frown Rainy days and Mondays always get me down.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Don't look at me. This was your idea.

speaker: MAYOR
line: Agent Mulder, welcome to Kroner. I'm Jim Gilmore, the mayor. We spoke on the phone.

speaker: MULDER
line: Nice to meet you, sir.

speaker: MAYOR
line: If I'd have known you was bringing the missus, I would've arranged for fancier accommodations.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm Agent Scully, Agent Mulder's partner. I'm... sure the accommodations will be just fine.

speaker: MAYOR
line: My apologies, ma'am. We appreciate your flying clear out here to help solve our crisis. I'd hoped for a bigger welcome, but, well... Okay, Rhonda that's enough. Go find your mama!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Uh, sir you mentioned a crisis. Agent Mulder has been a little … ah … vague as to the specifics of this crisis.

speaker: MAYOR
line: It's all around us-- runted crops, field fires, bankruptcies... This drought is destroying people's lives, and it's wrong for a single man to prosper at the expense of others.

speaker: SCULLY
line: A single man?

speaker: MAYOR
line: Daryl Mootz. He's a local fella charging people for rain.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You mean cloud seeding?

speaker: MAYOR
line: The hell I do. I mean he shows up at a farm, does his dog and pony act and the heavens weep.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, sir, if this man Mootz could, in fact, somehow produce rain then what's the crime?

speaker: MAYOR
line: I believe Daryl's causing the drought... so he can charge folks for the rain.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And this is what you told Agent Mulder when you spoke earlier?

speaker: MAYOR
line: Yes, ma'am. He seemed real eager to help us.

speaker: MULDER
line: Come on, Scully. You act like I intentionally misled you. Over the past 30 years this town has had more tornadoes heat waves and hailstorms than any other town in the country. It's like ground zero for extreme weather.

speaker: SCULLY
line: A man... controlling... the weather.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, if that's true-- if Daryl Mootz is controlling the weather for profit-- then that is a crime and that should be investigated.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, I see the vacant buildings. I see the signs. These people are scared. But there have always been droughts and natural disasters and people are always looking for a scapegoat.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, but how many scapegoats lease office space?

speaker: MULDER
line: Agents Mulder and Scully with the FBI. We're looking for Daryl Mootz.

speaker: CINDY
line: One second. Yes, ma'am. Appendix "C." That's right. I need a six-pack of beer, a carton of Morley Lights, and a big old bowl of jellybeans. And can you pick out all the green ones 'cause he don't like the green ones. You're welcome. Now, what can I do for the FBI?

speaker: MULDER
line: We want to see the king.

speaker: CINDY
line: I'm sorry. Mr. Mootz is out of the state till this afternoon on business.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, when you say "on business" you mean he's making it rain?

speaker: CINDY
line: Uh-huh. He's just across the state line into Nebraska. Town of Wymore.

speaker: SCULLY
line: If we could get a list of all the people who have employed his services, it would be helpful.

speaker: CINDY
line: I don't understand. Does he... Don't y'all need a warrant or a subpoena or something like that?

speaker: SCULLY
line: We usually just say, "please."

speaker: CINDY
line: What are you investigating Daryl for? He's a hero in this community.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So you actually believe that he makes it rain?

speaker: CINDY
line: I know it to be fact. He saved my daddy's farm. How dare you people.

speaker: HOLMAN
line: ...the only rain in the area is localized up around Wymore...

speaker: CINDY
line: See? Daryl's making that rain.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is it possible that he could have just followed it up there?

speaker: CINDY
line: Here's your damn client list. You'll see. Every one a satisfied customer.

speaker: MULDER
line: This, uh, TV station-- is that far from here?

speaker: SHEILA
line: Oh! We were beginning to worry that you wouldn't make it. Is this your first time in a TV studio? How exciting. I couldn't be happier for the two of you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm not su...

speaker: SHEILA
line: Holman, I'd like to introduce you to the Gundersons.

speaker: HOLMAN
line: Congratulations! I hope you have a truly romantic getaway.

speaker: SHEILA
line: Aren't you glad you watch Channel Five weather?

speaker: SCULLY
line: We're Agents Mulder and Scully. We're with the FBI.

speaker: SHEILA
line: FBI? Oh, my goodness! I thought you were the "Watch the Weather and Win" contest winners.

speaker: HOLMAN
line: See, we haven't had any rain in months and... well, people tend to blame the messenger.

speaker: SHEILA
line: Oh, there's the Gundersons. Over here!

speaker: MULDER
line: It's like looking in a mirror.

speaker: HOLMAN
line: When I first saw the pair of you I thought you were rather smartly dressed for a farm couple. Make yourselves at home.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, from what I've read about Kroner you've had more than your fair share of unusual weather.

speaker: HOLMAN
line: Well, we certainly have. To you, Kroner must seem small and simple but through the eyes of meteorology-- low pressure systems, storm fronts, tornado watches-- Kroner is sophisticated, complex and... well... sexy. And... frankly I can't imagine a more exciting place to be a meteorologist.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Uh, Mr. Hardt, what can you tell us about Daryl Mootz?

speaker: HOLMAN
line: The Mayor called you in, didn't he? He thinks Daryl's causing the drought.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You don't think he's responsible.

speaker: HOLMAN
line: Of course not. A huge high-pressure system is the primary culprit. There's no credible evidence to suggest that Daryl, or any man can be held accountable for our predicament.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Thank you. Can we go now?

speaker: MULDER
line: No, no, um... What about the rain?

speaker: HOLMAN
line: Well, that's a more clouded issue if you'll excuse my pun.

speaker: MULDER
line: I have a list of over 40 names here-- people in four different counties-- who claim that Daryl Mootz has made it rain for them.

speaker: HOLMAN
line: I went to high school with Daryl. Different social circles and... frankly, he's about the last man I would give credit to for anything...

speaker: SCULLY
line: I hear a big "but" coming.

speaker: HOLMAN
line: Daryl appears to be the real deal. I can't explain it, but... where he wanders, showers follow.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Look at the desperation on these people's faces, Mulder. They're ready to believe anything.

speaker: MULDER
line: According to his schedule the King should have been here by now.

speaker: FARMER AND FAMILY
line: Here he comes! Here he comes! He's here! Oh, isn't that sweet? That's sweet.

speaker: DARYL
line: Man! What could we use around here, a little rain? Oh, look at this! Ah! Take these, will you, somebody? Ah. Mmm.

speaker: DARYL
line: That is the wrong damn boot, now, isn't it, hon? Be a good girl, and go on and get me the red snakeskin.

speaker: DARYL
line: Well, looky here. The FBI.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We just came to see the show. I guess, uh, we're a little early.

speaker: DARYL
line: Oh, ye of little faith. That truck out there of mine is a whole lot faster than my rain clouds.

speaker: CINDY
line: Excuse me.

speaker: DARYL
line: Thank you.

speaker: MULDER
line: How do you explain your unique ability?

speaker: DARYL
line: I don't. It's complicated.

speaker: MULDER
line: Try me. I watch the Weather Channel.

speaker: DARYL
line: If you're wondering did I ask for this gift no, sir, I did not, no more than I asked to lose this here limb. But I should've expected it and I'll tell you why. Because I come from a long line of healing people. I'm a spiritual man, in touch... with the really real. The, the unseen real.

speaker: DARYL
line: And I... am one 64th Cherokee and I can summon up my ancestors to bring water to this thirsty land. Yeah!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, what are we doing here?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, this is not without historical precedent. The Old West was full of traveling men who claimed to be rainmakers. The Pueblo Indians even had a rain dance.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, that is not a rain dance. My Irish Aunt Olive has more Cherokee in her than Daryl Mootz. I mean, look at him, Mulder. Does that look like a man who can control the weather?

speaker: SHEILA
line: Are we still going to the reunion together on Friday?

speaker: HOLMAN
line: Absolutely. Social event of the decade.

speaker: SHEILA
line: Hard to believe it's been 20 years since we finished high school. Where did the time go? What were those FBI people looking for?

speaker: HOLMAN
line: Oh, they were asking questions about Daryl. About making it rain.

speaker: SHEILA
line: I wish they'd just go back to wherever they came from and leave him alone.

speaker: HOLMAN
line: You don't still love him, do you? I can't believe you still care about him after the way he treated you.

speaker: SHEILA
line: I know.

speaker: HOLMAN
line: He never loved you, Sheila. All he cared about was your money, and as soon as he got some of his own... he just …

speaker: SHEILA
line: He left. I know. But I think he used to love me.

speaker: HOLMAN
line: There are other men who will love you more.

speaker: SHEILA
line: FBI-- my lord. I don't think I'll be able to sleep knowing they're poking round.

speaker: MAN WITH CHAINSAW
line: Ma'am, unless you want to get covered in hamburger I reckon you should step outside.

speaker: HOTEL MANAGER
line: Oh, miss, we moved your boyfriend's things into your room.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He's my partner, and we prefer separate rooms.

speaker: HOTEL MANAGER
line: Oh, old-fashioned are you, huh? Well, we're booked solid with the high school reunion. You can take it or leave it.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: We can just butterfly it. I've got my kit over in the car.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, I don't think it's a coincidence that a cow gets hurled at me just as we're down here investigating the weather.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, did they check you for head trauma?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm telling you, that cow had my name on it.

speaker: HOLMAN
line: Agent Mulder, are you all right? I feel terrible. If there's anything I can do, please don't hesitate.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Perhaps there is. Mr. Hardt, would you please reassure Agent Mulder that this cow incident was, in fact, a natural phenomenon?

speaker: HOLMAN
line: With pleasure. Uh, it's my belief that a mini-twister picked that poor creature up, lifted it about 12,000 feet where the air cooled and, uh... I'm just grateful you weren't hurt any worse.

speaker: SHEILA
line: Excuse me.

speaker: HOLMAN
line: You shouldn't be here.

speaker: SHEILA
line: Holman, don't make this any harder. It's my fault. I did it.

speaker: SHEILA
line: I'm so sorry. I didn't mean for this to happen. It's not something that I can control.

speaker: MULDER
line: Are you saying that you're somehow responsible for the...

speaker: SHEILA
line: I murdered that poor cow!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Uh... Holman just explained to us that, uh, that a mini-twister is what caused the accident.

speaker: SHEILA
line: He's just being sweet, covering for me. He knows the truth. This isn't the first time something like this has happened. The night of my senior prom a tornado demolished our high school...

speaker: (QUICK FLASHBACK
line: Exterior of high school gym. Heavy winds and rain. A couple in full prom regalia walking toward the building are suddenly lifted into the air and blown away by the storm.)

speaker: SHEILA
line: And then... On my wedding day, a day I'd always dreamed about the ceremony was outdoors on the Fourth of July weekend. It snowed six inches.

speaker: (QUICK FLASHBACK
line: SHEILA and wedding party stand outside in heavy snowfall.)

speaker: SHEILA
line: Then three years later my husband ran off with some gal from the phone company and on the day that our divorce was finalized I stepped out of the courthouse and... you know how you-you-you can see shapes in those big fluffy clouds?

speaker: SHEILA
line: Well... I swear that every cloud in that big blue sky was a face laughing at me...

speaker: (QUICK FLASHBACK
line: a very eighties looking SHEILA stands on courthouse steps looking up at clouds that all look like smiling faces.)

speaker: SHEILA
line: And that was about ten years ago and that was the last time it happened until last night.

speaker: MULDER
line: What's your connection to Daryl Mootz?

speaker: SHEILA
line: Well... We used to be engaged.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You two were engaged?

speaker: SHEILA
line: Yeah, about six months ago and, um... we had a fight and he took a drive, and... and a... and a freak hailstorm cost him his leg.

speaker: MULDER
line: And ever since then, the rain's been following him.

speaker: SHEILA
line: Am I under arrest?

speaker: MULDER
line: No. I can tell you without a doubt that you're not responsible for any of that weather.

speaker: SHEILA
line: Oh... But...

speaker: MULDER
line: Agent Scully and I specialize in these types of cases and-and-and although you may have had some bad luck you didn't cause any of it.

speaker: SHEILA
line: Are you sure?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, yeah, I'm... I'm sure. Scully, you have any doubts?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No.

speaker: MULDER
line: You see?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No doubts.

speaker: SHEILA
line: I really want to believe you. Thanks.

speaker: MULDER
line: You're welcome.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: That hailstorm didn't cause Daryl's car crash.

speaker: MULDER
line: What are you talking about?

speaker: DOCTOR
line: The weather was bad, but Daryl was drunk and driving too fast.

speaker: HOLMAN
line: Drunk? I... never heard that.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: We all felt that Daryl losing his leg was punishment enough.

speaker: DARYL
line: People don't realize how hard a work this is. I mean, sure, it looks like I'm just sitting here, but... My powers of concentration... Oh, yeah, oh, right there, yeah, yeah. Yeah, oh, you... You're worth every penny. Now, what was I saying?

speaker: CINDY
line: "Powers of concentration."

speaker: DARYL
line: Yeah, right. Right. I... m-my brain's functioning on something like-- I don't know-- 14 different levels taking in a whole bunch of variables like wind velocity and-and humidity and...

speaker: CINDY
line: Daryl... Do you hear that?

speaker: DARYL
line: Hear what?

speaker: CINDY
line: The rain stopped.

speaker: DARYL
line: Uh-oh.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Next flight out is 10:00 tomorrow morning.

speaker: MULDER
line: Look at this, Scully September 20, 1991, it rained rose petals for nearly an hour.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, we're going home. The rain stopped this afternoon. Daryl Mootz is being sued by about 50 people. There's no case... And you told Sheila yourself that she wasn't controlling the weather.

speaker: MULDER
line: She's not. Neither is Daryl. Check this out-- on the same day that it rained rose petals. "Irene Hardt, beloved wife and devoted mother passed away yesterday afternoon... She's survived by one son, Holman Hardt."

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, so, now you're saying that Holman Hardt...

speaker: MULDER
line: Holman Hardt is manufacturing the weather. Did you see how relieved he was when he learned that Daryl was drunk? I've been doing some checking. Holman Hardt has been hospitalized five times with nervous exhaustion, each time coinciding with a major meteorological event.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, it is still a huge leap to say that he's manufacturing the weather.

speaker: MULDER
line: Most people will admit that the weather plays a significant role in the way they feel, right? There's even that disorder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: "SAD"-seasonal affective disorder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mm-hmm, yeah. Well, who's to say that it doesn't work the other way around-- that the way someone feels can affect the weather... that the weather is somehow an expression of Holman Hardt's feelings or-or-or better still, the feelings that he's not expressing?

speaker: HOLMAN
line: I've tried to say this a thousand times... tried to express the... fire that burns inside this... humble exterior. Sheila, you're the reason I remained in this town all these years.

speaker: HOLMAN
line: I wake up each day knowing...

speaker: HOLMAN
line: Hello?

speaker: SHEILA
line: Holman, it's me. Working late?

speaker: HOLMAN
line: Sh-sheila, hi. Yeah, um... I was just thinking about you. I'm looking forward to the reunion tomorrow night.

speaker: SHEILA
line: Me, too.

speaker: HOLMAN
line: You sound in a good mood.

speaker: SHEILA
line: Well, I am, Holman, and it's all because of you. I wanted to let you know that I've been thinking about what you said about Daryl yesterday and I realized that you were right.

speaker: HOLMAN
line: I was?

speaker: SHEILA
line: Yes, you were, and I am so over him. "Daryl who?" That's what I say. I realized that I've been chasing the wrong kind of guy. I need someone who I can talk to. I need someone who I can feel safe with.

speaker: HOLMAN
line: I can't tell you what that means to me.

speaker: SHEILA
line: Holman, I want to ask you something and I hope that we can keep it our secret for the time being.

speaker: HOLMAN
line: Of course, Sheila, anything.

speaker: SHEILA
line: Well, what do you think of Agent Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey, Holman.

speaker: HOLMAN
line: Agent Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: I've come to say good-bye, Holman.

speaker: HOLMAN
line: You're leaving.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah. But I want you to get some help before you kill somebody.

speaker: HOLMAN
line: Help? What are you talking about?

speaker: MULDER
line: You know what I'm talking about. You're not just a weatherman, you're the weatherman. You're the person who's been affecting the weather.

speaker: HOLMAN
line: Agent Mulder, if I could control the weather don't you think I would make it rain? That I would end this drought?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't think it works that way. I don't think you don't do it on purpose. I just think you bottle up your emotions-- anger, grief, or love or whatever-- and then, as a response, it rains or hails or there's a flying cow.

speaker: HOLMAN
line: That poor animal.

speaker: MULDER
line: And whatever it is, you got to let it out.

speaker: HOLMAN
line: I can't.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, you can. It's Sheila, isn't it? You love her. You've always loved her. That, uh, tornado at the high school... that was you, wasn't it?

speaker: HOLMAN
line: The night of our senior prom, I, uh... accidentally stumbled upon her and her boyfriend... in flagrante delicto. And the next thing you know...

speaker: MULDER
line: And you've never told her the way you feel?

speaker: HOLMAN
line: How can a frog tell a swan that he loves her?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, you better tell her or you're going to kill somebody.

speaker: HOLMAN
line: W-well, you got to help me.

speaker: MULDER
line: I got a plane to catch.

speaker: HOLMAN
line: You can't go. If you don't help me, who will?

speaker: MULDER
line: I am meeting my partner at the airport.

speaker: MULDER
line: Excuse me. Hold on. Mulder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, it's me.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm on my way.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm not so sure. Have you looked outside lately? It's pea soup. Our plane can't take off until after this fog lifts.

speaker: MULDER
line: Fog? Holman!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Holman?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah... he wants advice. Dating advice.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Dating advice? From whom?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yours truly. Hello? Hey, Scully. Scully, you there?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I heard you. Mulder, when was the last time you went on a date?

speaker: MULDER
line: I will talk to you later.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The blind leading the blind.

speaker: DARYL
line: This red number?

speaker: CINDY
line: Daryl, you're like one of those tragic rock stars. You know, like, like Jim Morrison or Kurt Cobain. You just shine too bright for too short a time. We'll tell our kids all about it.

speaker: DARYL
line: Kids. Can't afford kids. If I don't come up with a lot of cash pronto I am in deep doo-doo.

speaker: CINDY
line: Dairy Queen will take me back. I get almost six dollars an hour.

speaker: DARYL
line: Shh. I'm thinking. There's got to be somebody...

speaker: CINDY
line: We'll get the money, baby.

speaker: DARYL
line: Sheila.

speaker: CINDY
line: what about her?

speaker: DARYL
line: Cindy... You have been real sweet and all but I think we can use some time apart.

speaker: CINDY
line: What? Are you breaking up with me?

speaker: DARYL
line: Nothing personal.

speaker: HOLMAN
line: I've been envious of men like you my whole life. Based on your physical bearing, I'd assumed you were... More experienced. I mean... You spend every day with agent Scully a beautiful, enchanting woman. And you two never, uh...? I... confess I find that shocking. I... I've seen how you two gaze at one another.

speaker: MULDER
line: This is about you, Holman. I'm here to help you. I'm perfectly happy with my friendship with Agent Scully.

speaker: HOLMAN
line: So according to your theory I walk in there, tell her I love her and the drought will end?

speaker: MULDER
line: Just tell her how you feel.

speaker: MULDER
line: And Holman. I do not gaze at Scully.

speaker: HOLMAN
line: Hey.

speaker: SHEILA
line: Hey. I can't find my notes for my... …presentation. Here they are.

speaker: HOLMAN
line: You got a minute?

speaker: SHEILA
line: For you, always. Are you excited about the high school reunion tonight?

speaker: HOLMAN
line: Of course. Uh... You're busy. We can talk later.

speaker: SHEILA
line: Oh, what is it?

speaker: HOLMAN
line: I... I love you.

speaker: SHEILA
line: I love you, too. Holman. What's wrong?

speaker: WOMAN IN TV STATION
line: Is that rain? Oh, my gosh, it is! It's raining!

speaker: MULDER
line: Well?

speaker: SHEILA
line: Good afternoon, Agent Mulder. See you tonight, Holman.

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh, you did it.

speaker: HOLMAN
line: No, you did it.

speaker: MULDER
line: What are you talking about?

speaker: HOLMAN
line: She said that she loves me but that she's in love with you.

speaker: DARYL
line: What do you mean there's somebody else?

speaker: SHEILA
line: Daryl, this isn't the place.

speaker: DARYL
line: Just tell me who it is.

speaker: SHEILA
line: Let me go!

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey! Hey, Daryl. Cut it out, man.

speaker: DARYL
line: Him? This is the guy?! Oh, what's he got that I ain't got?

speaker: SHEILA
line: A job. A way with words. Intelligence. Good looks.

speaker: DARYL
line: Good looking? I'll show you good looking.

speaker: SHEILA
line: Daryl! No, not his face!

speaker: MULDER
line: Daryl.

speaker: SHEILA
line: Don't you hit him in the face!

speaker: DARYL
line: Oh, good. Picking on a cripple. You'll hear from my lawyer.

speaker: SHEILA
line: You deserve a big reward.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, the fog has lifted and if you're ready... the plane is waiting.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, do you know anything about, um... weather radar?

speaker: SCULLY
line: A bit. Why?

speaker: MULDER
line: What does red mean?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Thunderstorms, I think.

speaker: MULDER
line: Looks like we're not going to be able to catch our plane.

line: So I'd like to know where You got the notion Said I'd like to know where You got the notion Rock the boat Don't rock the boat, baby Rock the boat Don't tip the boat over Rock the boat Don't rock the boat, baby Rock the boat...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Seven inches in the past six hours. The national weather service has issued a flash flood warning for the county. Mulder, are you sure he's here?

line: If she's here, he'll be here.

speaker: MUSIC
line: So I'd like to know where You got the notion Said I'd like to know where You got the notion So I'd like to know where You got the notion So I'd like to know where You got the notion...

line: Come on, Holman, now make it stop.

line: This is your fault, not mine.

line: My fault?

line: You were kissing her.

speaker: SHEILA
line: Oh, look who's here's some of my favorite people. Old friend, … … and new ones.

line: You look very lovely tonight, Sheila.

speaker: SHEILA
line: Thank you. You look handsome. Both of you.

line: Oh, I love this song. Agent Mulder, care to dance?

line: Holman was just telling us that, uh, that he wanted to dance.

line: Yes, he was.

line: I would be honored.

line: Okay.

speaker: MULDER
line: Tell her, Holman.

line: You lay your bets and then you pay the price...

speaker: SHEILA
line: What was that Agent Mulder said? Tell me what?

speaker: HOLMAN
line: Oh, no big deal.

speaker: SHEILA
line: We tell each other everything, don't we?

speaker: HOLMAN
line: Well... um... when I stopped by your office this afternoon... when I said that...

speaker: SHEILA
line: When you said you loved me.

speaker: HOLMAN
line: What I meant to say... what I wanted you to understand... is that I'm in love with you. That I've loved you since high school.

speaker: MUSIC
line: Ooh, you make me love you Ooh, you've got a way...

speaker: MULDER
line: I'll build the ark, you gather the animals.

speaker: MULDER
line: I was kidding.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sheila... my partner has a theory and even though I don't share his belief I feel that, given the circumstances you should hear his theory because it involves you and Holman. Agent Mulder believes that the drought, this storm these bizarre set of weather conditions that have plagued you over the years are... are caused by Holman. Specifically, that... that his emotions are somehow manifesting themselves in the weather and Agent Mulder believes that-that Holman is... unwittingly destroying this town because of his unspoken love for you.

speaker: SHEILA
line: You love him, don't you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: What?

speaker: SHEILA
line: You're jealous because Agent Mulder and I have a special connection and you're trying to divert me to Holman.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What?

speaker: DARYL
line: It is good to be the king! It is good to be the king! Where's Sheila?

speaker: MULDER
line: Where's your leg?

speaker: DARYL
line: Cindy took it. Said I'd have to crawl back to her. Now, where's Sheila?

speaker: SHEILA
line: Not even a kiss? Trust me, the man knows how to kiss. I just never thought of Holman that way, you know. He's my closest friend. And to not even suspect...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, it seems to me that the best relationships-- the ones that last-- are frequently the ones that are rooted in friendship. You know, one day you look at the person and you see something more than you did the night before. Like a switch has been flicked somewhere. And the person who was just a friend is... suddenly the only person you can ever imagine yourself with.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The storm drains are filling up. Let's get out of here.

line: I'll teach you to mess with my woman. If I had two legs I'd kick your...

line: I called the police.

speaker: MULDER
line: You might want to take a look at the king-- make sure he's all right. Whatever happened to Sheila?

line: Is it true? That you make the weather? Because of me? The tornado in high school, snow at my wedding?

line: I'm so sorry.

line: Daryl's rain?

speaker: HOLMAN
line: Can't explain the logic of it. Yes. Some strange manifestation of guilt.

line: Even this rain? Because you love me?

line: Because... I love you.

line: That is the most romantic thing I've ever heard.
